positive.review:
such a sweet and meaningful game! i reallyy love how it explores real emotions and the challenges that come with any relationship. it’s thoughtful, emotional, and shows that love is built on trust, effort, and the little things we often overlook when things get rough. if you approach things in a healthy and understanding way, you can truly shape your own ending here! beautiful reminder that love isn’t just about big gestures, but the little things that matter most.
this game captures it all perfectly <3

A simple, cute game I can appreciate for all the little details it includes. With three stories and various endings, that of which can intertwine in more ways than you would think, I’m not sure it’s a game for everyone but those that like simple and cute experiences might want to give it a shot. Sadly there’s just not much to say.
Loved this game!! It was emotional, fun and lovely to play to the minigames, to find other endings and the credits music is chef's kiss! I had a lovely time playing! <3

What a story, the story was an absolute story.
What a great way to introduce someone about how "relationship" could be created, expand, or even ended. Moreover, the puzzle kind of makes that specific sense which are "Action speaks louder".
Spoiler alert : This game behaves by the user interaction itself, so try to click or connect something.

I'm quite into the style of this game. Yes, it is simple but that simplicity create that kind of "vibe".
So simple yet so wonderful.

Thanks for making a great game and I absolutely recommended for you guys to try it out. Would recommend !!
The answer may not be in the options, but in life, you won't have the chance to choose again. Take care.

LoveChoice is a short interactive visual novel that examines modern relationships through branching micro-stories. Instead of a single long narrative, it presents multiple scenarios that explore communication, emotional distance, and personal responsibility. The tone is quiet and reflective, aiming to evoke consideration rather than dramatic twists.

Gameplay focuses on simple dialogue choices and interactive prompts. Players make small decisions such as sending messages, selecting reactions, or choosing how to respond in awkward situations. These mechanics are minimalist, but they reinforce the theme that minor choices shape larger emotional outcomes. The interactivity supports the writing instead of distracting from it.

Each story features multiple endings. Some outcomes feel optimistic, others bittersweet, and a few highlight how miscommunication can fracture relationships. The branching paths encourage replay, allowing players to experiment with different communication styles. The short runtime makes this iteration practical rather than tedious.

Visually, the game uses soft, hand-drawn art with clean color palettes. Character expressions are understated but readable, and simple animations emphasize emotional beats. The user interface is uncluttered, presenting text and options clearly. Sound design supports the mood with gentle music loops that never dominate the experience.

Writing is concise and grounded. Characters feel believable without relying on heavy exposition. Dialogue avoids melodrama, focusing instead on common relational problems like insecurity, time management, and trust. The tone aims for empathy without leaning into sentimentality.

Technical performance is stable. Load times are quick, saves are flexible, and interactions respond cleanly. There are no complex systems to break, and the overall experience is accessible even on modest hardware. Localization quality is solid across supported languages, with few awkward phrases.

Overall, LoveChoice succeeds as a compact narrative experiment that explores everyday relationship dynamics. It lacks mechanical depth and large-scale storytelling, but within its small scope it offers thoughtful scenarios, gentle presentation, and meaningful replay value. Players interested in quiet emotional storytelling will find it worthwhile.
pretty good game, cute histories and good soundtrack
This was thee cutest love story game i have ever touched, it really moved me and even made me feel strong emotions when i played it, this is a really great story.
loved it
Games have taught me a lot, but unfortunately, there are no chances to start over in real life; what’s done is done. Perhaps we will never meet again, so I just wish her eternal happiness!

A message to the men who have reached the stage in their lives in which they feel abundantly lost in there pursuit of genuine love. Maybe there was one, maybe there have been a few, or maybe you have never felt a genuine connection with someone. I want you all who take the time to read and the thought to consider purchasing this to take this to heart. No piece of media has ever made me rethink the way i approach women the way this game has. Nor has any other piece of media made me realize the lack of care i can put into finding balance and peace with a partner. For $2 and 2 hours you have an opportunity to experience something that could teach you how to open up your heart and allow love to find you. I recommend anyone play this game, even if it ends up in your hidden folder and you never discuss it. May you all will find an individual who offers you grace in your times of chaos, strength in your times of weakness, and joy in your times of sadness... Dawn is the first appearance of light in the sky before sunrise, what a fitting name.

Good game...
计量写不下去了想着玩一下，结果一下就玩完了。。
玩第二章的时候真的很代入TT。。痛痛

such a sweet and meaningful game! i reallyy love how it explores real emotions and the challenges that come with any relationship. it’s thoughtful, emotional, and shows that love is built on trust, effort, and the little things we often overlook when things get rough. if you approach things in a healthy and understanding way, you can truly shape your own ending here! beautiful reminder that love isn’t just about big gestures, but the little things that matter most.
this game captures it all perfectly <3

Truly amazing game and i will take these core messages to heart and improvise my relationship based on them. Is what i would do if i wasn't here alone playing a steamgame about something il never experience.

Pretty short game, took me about 2 hours to explore the entirety of the game and obtain all achievements.

Let's start with the biggest issue I had - the writing. It could definitely use some improvements because it is severely lacking in finer details. The mini stories are fine for what they offer, but I can't help but feel like the narrative could have been so much better if only the writing had a little more nuance to give the overarching story a bit more depth and emotional weight to really drive home the core message. There are also some gameplay mechanics that are not properly explained and left to the players to figure them out. You just need to be sure to interact with the whole screen and not just the dialog box.

With that said, I don't think the shortcomings are enough to completely dissuade other people from trying this game out. Overall, it's an honest game with a heart, and I suggest others give it a go.

TLDR: Not bad, but certainly could have been better. For the price, what it brings to the table is palatable enough. I give it a 7/10.

Although played from the boy's perspective, the story reveal from the girl's point of view is sensible too which can actually also be lesson or even considered relationship advice for those who play it regardless of the gender. The puzzles within the game made the scenarios even more realistic as it only hints that not only you can progress the story to have a good ending by making choices but also to think logically within each situation and become more insightful about your partner. This game, for me, is quite really great for something so light and fast-paced.
Playing this game took me back to early flash era style games about love and decisions, and I loved every part of it. The puzzles were clever and I fully recommend it to anyone.
The answer may not be in the options, but in life, you won't have the chance to choose again. Take care.

Sadly there’s just not much to say.

Such a sweet little game! :') I felt the writers' presence all throughout, it was so nice to connect with gentle souls through this game. It was a short but touching experience!
Solid little time, nothing crazy, but it is cute to play with your partner.

A fun game for a quick evening session with surprisingly extensive gameplay. However, the answer choices felt limited and sometimes strange. The themes of love and relationships were superficially explored, and important values were misrepresented. 

The game is worth the small price, but don't expect too much.
Cute fun little romance game 3 different storys to do there all pretty short but you can make them end in different ways so it has good replay ability even more if you go for the 100% 9/10

I don't know what to say, it's just cute and wholesome, multiple endings that teach you how a relationship should look like. Only really negative is that you probably wouldn't know you can click on more than just the boxes and be really confused why your answers don't do anything, I needed to use a guide lol

Instead of a single long narrative, it presents multiple scenarios that explore communication, emotional distance, and personal responsibility. The tone is quiet and reflective, aiming to evoke consideration rather than dramatic twists.

玩过《LoveChoice》之后，心里有很多感触。这真是个好游戏，它让我们能一次次读档重来，去追求那个完美的结局。可现实呢？现实往往没有第二次机会，失去了，就真的没有了。

游戏教会了我如何去爱，可那个我本该珍惜的人，已经不会回来了。想到这里，眼泪就忍不住掉下来。我真的好想提醒每一个人，请务必珍惜此刻陪在你身边的那个人，不要等到人家一次次失望，终于不想再等了，才想着去弥补，因为那真的弥补不回来了。

我很爱她，但我的方式却一步步推开了她，这大概是我最大的遗憾。最后我明白了，游戏只是一个预告片，它指引我们，但真正的故事都在现实里。当我们关闭游戏，面对现实的那一刻，才是《LoveChoice》真正想告诉我们的东西。

Love has never been a multiple-choice question with standard options. How could love be confined within rigid rules? In fact, the greatest regret is not that we chose wrongly, but that we didn't try to pick up the answer right before us. That is truly "picking up love" that we called "Love Choice".
pretty good game, cute histories and good soundtrack
This was thee cutest love story game i have ever touched, it really moved me and even made me feel strong emotions when i played it, this is a really great story.

Short game about exploring the concept of love and relationship by letting you experience the stories of a few couples. There's not much gameplay as the game focuses on the narrative a lot more which it does very well. It can be quite confusing to find the correct choices at the start but it's fine considering you are meant to fail a few times before figuring it out.

THIS IS BULLSHIT! 
you're telling me to win the game I'll have to pay attention and listen to the dialogue said, think before I act to find good solutions to problems and balance both trying hard for my lover while also allowing things to develope naturally over time???

oh wait...
This was such a wonderful game and it was so heartwarming to play.
Fingers crossed this $0.00 investment pays off

negative.review: it's cute &  very short which is good. I personally didn't like the story that much but it teaches (kinda obvious) values of romantic relationships.

I feel bad leaving a negative review, so I will say some positives. It’s cheap. The art style is cute (it’s an art style I like a lot actually), and the idea of adding point and click puzzles to the story is creative. 
However, that’s also a part of the problem with the game. You have dialogue choices, like you would with any visual novel or story game, but if you just use those, then you’re guaranteed to get a bad ending. To get anything different, you have to somehow figure out what you’re supposed to click on, on the screen. I had no idea what I was doing wrong and had to look up a guide to figure out how to even play this properly. 
After that, it was an okay game. None of the stories really stuck with me, though.
Interesting concept, but it could’ve been executed better.
Do you like when things happen in slow motion with no real direction? This is the game for you then! Otherwise, hard pass.
pure dogshxt full of stereotypes
Huge no

A NEET's idea of what "romance" and "love" is. It's corny, bland, and the music is not interesting (just a piano). The female character is a 2D cutout. She has no depth, she has no thoughts our character really delves into. It's a really surface level relationship we see. 

Male character is unimaginably corny to a point that I was cringing. Game doesn't really show any proper flaws of the male character. If you are a woman, you will not like this guy or the game for that matter. It has such an intense male gaze that it is borderline embarrasing. 

The choices you make do not seem to really make a big difference in the story. It's such a bland story as well. There is no drama, no substance, nothing interesting is happening. If this was a free game I would understand, however even for as little money 2€ is, I wouldn't suggest anyone buying.

I geniunely could not make myself play this game any more after 25 mins. I don't care if it gets any good or if it becomes the best game ever. You lost me at the start, no point going forward.

This game tells the story from a male perspective, which, as a female myself, does not really like and cannot really relate to. It somehow reinforced the stereotypic opinions that males might have on females' expectation in relationships. I personally cannot relate to the "right choices" that would lead to a "happy ending." Maybe this game and its storytelling is just not for me. I feel like it portrays the female character in such a passive way, which almost made them feel like the receiving/responding end of the main male characters' actions and words. The Detective chapter is also weird somehow. I just feel like it portrays females as skeptical and insecure. The male character seems to only do chores (e.g. clean  the litter box) on an anniversary, which is insane.

Where is the choice? You can select different replies all the time but the rest of the game doesnt change. However the game wants you to find two different endings to progress with the next story. You even have to look up a guide to find ceratin things to get the good ending.
Apart from that the relationship portayed here is completly toxic. The story even though it is so short is just not well written unfortunatly. Shes always uninterested and leaves you for any small bs. The only time she opens up and tells her feelings is, when she broke up already. Who came up with this

Game sets you up to failure and fustration by not explaining the mechanics (yes, there ARE mechanics but explaining it any further in this review would be a spoiler basically)

It's supposed to be a simple narrative game but in fact you have about 0% chance to reach a happy ending without looking up a guide

Yes the game is cheap but I'm sure there are even cheaper ways to get fustrated
it's cute &  very short which is good. I personally didn't like the story that much but it teaches (kinda obvious) values of romantic relationships.

However, that’s also a part of the problem with the game. You have dialogue choices, like you would with any visual novel or story game, but if you just use those, then you’re guaranteed to get a bad ending. Do you like when things happen in slow motion with no real direction? This is the game for you then! Otherwise, hard pass.

[b]TLDR; this is one of those VNs where the female love interest is seen more as an object or prize than an actual character. Your mileage may vary.[/b]

This game is made up of three separate VNs. They're mostly unrelated, but all of them play with the medium a bit. Most of the time picking dialogue options will steer you towards the bad ending while picking on parts of the environment will put you on course for a good ending, representing how actions are more important than words in a relationship. That's all well and good, but the occasionally uncomfortable writing really weighs this game down for me.

The first story left a foul taste in my mouth. You know something's off when the protagonist, in the second line of the entire game, says "if you're lucky, you'll get a girl on your game dev team." The meet cute falls completely flat because the protagonist instantly comes across as a somewhat manipulative lech only interested in getting in the love interest's pants. Yes, this is a problem with most romance VNs, but there's no self awareness at all. Likewise, the girl is constantly depicted as a nag who the boyfriend has to learn to put up with. Overall bland and kinda sexist; if it weren't for the gimmick of clicking on the environment instead of the dialogue prompts it'd be one of the worst VNs I've ever played.

The other two stories fare better but are still not very good. The second depicts a long distance relationship with many of the same gimmicks as the first, and (thankfully) is not afraid to call out the protagonist in the bad ending for being an ass. It reminded me a lot of Emily is Away, just with way less nuance and personality. The third story is a point and click game of a woman going through her husband's elaborate anniversary surprise gift. It's mostly harmless, but the achievement titles in it gave me some "women belong in the home/kitchen" vibes. Yikes!

If you're an achievement hunter/trading card fanatic and just want another cheap, easy VN to fill out your ranks, go for it. But if you're looking for something more, there are better options out there.
I paid $1.59 and still requested a refund. That says a lot.

[h1]#tinygamereviews[/h1]
[code]cute visuals and concept, but it fell pretty flat for me.[/code]
[list]
    [*][b][u]Overall Score[/u][/b]: 2/5
[/list]
[hr][/hr]
[h1][b]Curator: [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/42137521/]Nostalginauts[/url][/b][/h1]

A NEET's idea of what "romance" and "love" is. It's corny, bland, and the music is not interesting (just a piano). The female character is a 2D cutout. She has no depth, she has no thoughts our character really delves into. It's a really surface level relationship we see. 

Male character is unimaginably corny to a point that I was cringing. Game doesn't really show any proper flaws of the male character. If you are a woman, you will not like this guy or the game for that matter. It has such an intense male gaze that it is borderline embarrasing. 

The choices you make do not seem to really make a big difference in the story. It's such a bland story as well. There is no drama, no substance, nothing interesting is happening. If this was a free game I would understand, however even for as little money 2€ is, I wouldn't suggest anyone buying.

I geniunely could not make myself play this game any more after 25 mins. I don't care if it gets any good or if it becomes the best game ever. You lost me at the start, no point going forward.

This game tells the story from a male perspective, which, as a female myself, does not really like and cannot really relate to. It somehow reinforced the stereotypic opinions that males might have on females' expectation in relationships. I personally cannot relate to the "right choices" that would lead to a "happy ending." Maybe this game and its storytelling is just not for me. I feel like it portrays the female character in such a passive way, which almost made them feel like the receiving/responding end of the main male characters' actions and words. The Detective chapter is also weird somehow. I just feel like it portrays females as skeptical and insecure. The male character seems to only do chores (e.g. clean  the litter box) on an anniversary, which is insane.

Where is the choice? You can select different replies all the time but the rest of the game doesnt change. However the game wants you to find two different endings to progress with the next story. You even have to look up a guide to find ceratin things to get the good ending.
Apart from that the relationship portayed here is completly toxic. The story even though it is so short is just not well written unfortunatly. Shes always uninterested and leaves you for any small bs. The only time she opens up and tells her feelings is, when she broke up already. Who came up with this

Game sets you up to failure and fustration by not explaining the mechanics (yes, there ARE mechanics but explaining it any further in this review would be a spoiler basically)

It's supposed to be a simple narrative game but in fact you have about 0% chance to reach a happy ending without looking up a guide

Yes the game is cheap but I'm sure there are even cheaper ways to get fustrated
it's cute &  very short which is good. I personally didn't like the story that much but it teaches (kinda obvious) values of romantic relationships.

I feel bad leaving a negative review, so I will say some positives. It’s cheap. The art style is cute (it’s an art style I like a lot actually), and the idea of adding point and click puzzles to the story is creative. 
However, that’s also a part of the problem with the game. You have dialogue choices, like you would with any visual novel or story game, but if you just use those, then you’re guaranteed to get a bad ending. To get anything different, you have to somehow figure out what you’re supposed to click on, on the screen. I had no idea what I was doing wrong and had to look up a guide to figure out how to even play this properly. 
After that, it was an okay game. None of the stories really stuck with me, though.
Interesting concept, but it could’ve been executed better.
Do you like when things happen in slow motion with no real direction? This is the game for you then! Otherwise, hard pass.

[b]TLDR; this is one of those VNs where the female love interest is seen more as an object or prize than an actual character. Your mileage may vary.[/b]

This game is made up of three separate VNs. They're mostly unrelated, but all of them play with the medium a bit. Most of the time picking dialogue options will steer you towards the bad ending while picking on parts of the environment will put you on course for a good ending, representing how actions are more important than words in a relationship. That's all well and good, but the occasionally uncomfortable writing really weighs this game down for me.

The first story left a foul taste in my mouth. You know something's off when the protagonist, in the second line of the entire game, says "if you're lucky, you'll get a girl on your game dev team." The meet cute falls completely flat because the protagonist instantly comes across as a somewhat manipulative lech only interested in getting in the love interest's pants. Yes, this is a problem with most romance VNs, but there's no self awareness at all. Likewise, the girl is constantly depicted as a nag who the boyfriend has to learn to put up with. Overall bland and kinda sexist; if it weren't for the gimmick of clicking on the environment instead of the dialogue prompts it'd be one of the worst VNs I've ever played.

The other two stories fare better but are still not very good. The second depicts a long distance relationship with many of the same gimmicks as the first, and (thankfully) is not afraid to call out the protagonist in the bad ending for being an ass. It reminded me a lot of Emily is Away, just with way less nuance and personality. The third story is a point and click game of a woman going through her husband's elaborate anniversary surprise gift. It's mostly harmless, but the achievement titles in it gave me some "women belong in the home/kitchen" vibes. Yikes!

If you're an achievement hunter/trading card fanatic and just want another cheap, easy VN to fill out your ranks, go for it. But if you're looking for something more, there are better options out there.
I paid $1.59 and still requested a refund. That says a lot.

A NEET's idea of what "romance" and "love" is. It's corny, bland, and the music is not interesting (just a piano). The female character is a 2D cutout. She has no depth, she has no thoughts our character really delves into. It's a really surface level relationship we see. 

Male character is unimaginably corny to a point that I was cringing. Game doesn't really show any proper flaws of the male character. If you are a woman, you will not like this guy or the game for that matter. It has such an intense male gaze that it is borderline embarrasing. 

The choices you make do not seem to really make a big difference in the story. It's such a bland story as well. There is no drama, no substance, nothing interesting is happening. If this was a free game I would understand, however even for as little money 2€ is, I wouldn't suggest anyone buying.

I geniunely could not make myself play this game any more after 25 mins. I don't care if it gets any good or if it becomes the best game ever. You lost me at the start, no point going forward.

This game tells the story from a male perspective, which, as a female myself, does not really like and cannot really relate to. It somehow reinforced the stereotypic opinions that males might have on females' expectation in relationships. I personally cannot relate to the "right choices" that would lead to a "happy ending." Maybe this game and its storytelling is just not for me. I feel like it portrays the female character in such a passive way, which almost made them feel like the receiving/responding end of the main male characters' actions and words. The Detective chapter is also weird somehow. I just feel like it portrays females as skeptical and insecure. The male character seems to only do chores (e.g. clean  the litter box) on an anniversary, which is insane.

Where is the choice? You can select different replies all the time but the rest of the game doesnt change. However the game wants you to find two different endings to progress with the next story. You even have to look up a guide to find ceratin things to get the good ending.
Apart from that the relationship portayed here is completly toxic. The story even though it is so short is just not well written unfortunatly. Shes always uninterested and leaves you for any small bs. The only time she opens up and tells her feelings is, when she broke up already. Who came up with this

Game sets you up to failure and fustration by not explaining the mechanics (yes, there ARE mechanics but explaining it any further in this review would be a spoiler basically)

It's supposed to be a simple narrative game but in fact you have about 0% chance to reach a happy ending without looking up a guide

Yes the game is cheap but I'm sure there are even cheaper ways to get fustrated
it's cute &  very short which is good. I personally didn't like the story that much but it teaches (kinda obvious) values of romantic relationships.

I feel bad leaving a negative review, so I will say some positives. It’s cheap. The art style is cute (it’s an art style I like a lot actually), and the idea of adding point and click puzzles to the story is creative. 
However, that’s also a part of the problem with the game. You have dialogue choices, like you would with any visual novel or story game, but if you just use those, then you’re guaranteed to get a bad ending. To get anything different, you have to somehow figure out what you’re supposed to click on, on the screen. I had no idea what I was doing wrong and had to look up a guide to figure out how to even play this properly. 
After that, it was an okay game. None of the stories really stuck with me, though.
Interesting concept, but it could’ve been executed better.
Do you like when things happen in slow motion with no real direction? This is the game for you then! Otherwise, hard pass.

[b]TLDR; this is one of those VNs where the female love interest is seen more as an object or prize than an actual character. Your mileage may vary.[/b]

This game is made up of three separate VNs. They're mostly unrelated, but all of them play with the medium a bit. Most of the time picking dialogue options will steer you towards the bad ending while picking on parts of the environment will put you on course for a good ending, representing how actions are more important than words in a relationship. That's all well and good, but the occasionally uncomfortable writing really weighs this game down for me.

The first story left a foul taste in my mouth. You know something's off when the protagonist, in the second line of the entire game, says "if you're lucky, you'll get a girl on your game dev team." The meet cute falls completely flat because the protagonist instantly comes across as a somewhat manipulative lech only interested in getting in the love interest's pants. Yes, this is a problem with most romance VNs, but there's no self awareness at all. Likewise, the girl is constantly depicted as a nag who the boyfriend has to learn to put up with. Overall bland and kinda sexist; if it weren't for the gimmick of clicking on the environment instead of the dialogue prompts it'd be one of the worst VNs I've ever played.

The other two stories fare better but are still not very good. The second depicts a long distance relationship with many of the same gimmicks as the first, and (thankfully) is not afraid to call out the protagonist in the bad ending for being an ass. It reminded me a lot of Emily is Away, just with way less nuance and personality. The third story is a point and click game of a woman going through her husband's elaborate anniversary surprise gift. It's mostly harmless, but the achievement titles in it gave me some "women belong in the home/kitchen" vibes. Yikes!

If you're an achievement hunter/trading card fanatic and just want another cheap, easy VN to fill out your ranks, go for it. But if you're looking for something more, there are better options out there.
I paid $1.59 and still requested a refund. That says a lot.
pure dogshxt full of stereotypes
Huge no
